message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about electrical conductivity and safety. Electric wires are designed to conduct electricity and it is important to avoid making contact with them to prevent electric shock. Options (A), (B), and (C) all involve materials that are good conductors of electricity, which means they would increase the risk of electric shock. Option (D), on the other hand, suggests wrapping the electric wire in thick cotton. Cotton is a poor conductor of electricity, so it would provide insulation and decrease the risk of electric shock.

This question requires knowledge about electrical conductivity and safety precautions. Option (D) states that the electric wire is wrapped in thick cotton, which is a non-conductive material. This means that it would prevent the flow of electricity and therefore ensure the least amount of risk when making contact with the wire. Options (A), (B), and (C) all involve materials (water, metal, steel) that are conductive and would allow electricity to flow, posing a higher risk of electric shock.

This question requires basic knowledge about electrical conductivity and safety. Option (D), an electric wire wrapped in thick cotton, would ensure the least amount of risk to make contact with. Cotton is a poor conductor of electricity, so it would act as an insulator, preventing electricity from passing through and reducing the risk of electric shock. Option (A), an electric wire wrapped in water, is extremely dangerous as water is a good conductor of electricity. Option (B), an electric wire wrapped in metal, and Option (C), an electric wire wrapped in steel, would also conduct electricity and pose a higher risk of electric shock than cotton.

This question requires basic knowledge about electrical safety. The least risky option to make contact with in this scenario would be an electric wire wrapped in thick cotton. Cotton is a poor conductor of electricity and would provide insulation, reducing the risk of electric shock. Option (A) is dangerous because water is a good conductor of electricity and could increase the risk of electric shock. Option (B) is also risky because metal is a good conductor of electricity. Option (C) is similar to option (B) since steel is also a good conductor of electricity.
